So, some of the poorest service I have ever experienced, misleading advertising, surly/miserable/rude staff and awful public areas. Thank goodness there are plenty of alternative hotels for future visits and for us to recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: JCowell
Reviews.Content: Overall, this Hotel provided us with exacly what we needed. The rooms were very spacious and immaculately kept. The staff were all very freindly and polite and on hand 24 hours a day. The hotel was cheap for us to book so we weren't expecting very much but we were both very pleased with everything about the Meineke Mark Hotel. I would receomend this Hotel for anyone visiting Berlin for the first time as it holds an excellent central location but remained just far enough off the main street to get a good nights sleep. The rail links from here are also easily reached by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mila016
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated right off the Kudamm and within 5 minutes walk from the Kudamm u-bahn station. I had booked online and asked for a non-smoking room, and I got it. In fact, the room was enormous and very luxurious. We were quite sad to only stay one night, but we had to catch a train to Poland at 6:30am the next morning. Despite our checking out before 6:30am, the time at which the breakfast started, we were invited to have a seat and to eat from the buffet before our departure. Although not everything was available yet, we had a great selection of breads, cheeses and cold cuts. Also, the staff was friendly and helpful. We stayed three other nights in Berlin later in August at a much more expensive, and supposedly better rated hotel. Hands down, the Berlin Mark Hotel was superior in value, not only location wise but also service wise. I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal and nice area”
Reviews.Author: tdog17
Reviews.Content: For 88 euros a night (double room), this hotel is an excellent value. The lobby isn't very impressive, and we were a bit worried as we headed up to our room, but it was fairly modern, clean and had a nice view down to the road. I had read that the street was a bit noisy, but we found it to be very quiet actually. Slept VERY well. This hotel is also dog-friendly, though there aren't any parks very close by. Secure parking is available in the garage next door for 11 euros a day. Overall, we were very pleased with our pick and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: futureTom
Reviews.Content: We rated this hotel above average, despite it being our only experience of Berlin hotels, but at £50 per night for a reasonably sized double room including a fine breakfast, who could ask for a better deal. Staff were always helpful on the few occasions we needed help. Meinekestrasse was a little noisy with the windows open, but we just used cheapo earplugs. Good area for transport, with the Zoo train station about five minutes walk providing access to pretty much everywhere, and a U-bahn station two minutes round the corner at Joachimstaler Str. Good eats to be had within 10 minute walking distance: Kuchi [Japanese], Good Friends [Chinese], Savigny Cafe [great coffee], and the beer garden at the Schleuse Tiergarten, possibly our favourite place. We recommend this hotel if you want proximity to Ku'damm and don't want to pay through the nose.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: xTravellerx
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good location near the shopping area, subway station, Kaiser Wilhelm Memorial Church etc. Rooms are quite small, but clean and modern. Plenty of TV channels in many languages. Nice breakfast, although the breakfast room is quite crowded. They had on some days another breakfast room opened on another floor. They were kind enough to allow us an early check-in. Polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Lancashire_Lass55
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was great, we really enjoyed our stay and will without a doubt stay there again. The location is perfect its about 3 minutes walk from the famous shopping street Ku'damm and access to public transport is same. The hotel itself is in our opinion fantastic value for money, we stayed in a double room which had a mini bar, flat screen t.v, comfortable bed with crisp white bed linen, great ensuite and more than enough storage, the little bunch of fresh flowers in the bathroom was a real nice touch! The breakfast was good, everything was so fresh, beautifully displayed and the choice of food was extensive, breakfast can be busy but there is ample tables, just need to look. Only real slight problem was being woke up on two nights by other residents, (adults not students!) but the hotel dealt with it very rapidly The staff in all departments were very friendly and very efficient.. Agreat value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Kadewe
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in January 2007 and based on past reviews was somewhat worried but my fears were unfounded. Positives were absolutely great central location on quiet side street, wonderful complete German breakfast included in the price, and a price that couldn't be beat for the location. In addition, the room itself was very up to date - non-smoking (though had to persist to get it), flat screen LCD TV on the wall, had a "chair" that opened to single bed for our son easily, had hair dryer (important for my wife), nice desk staff, very comfortable beds for my wife and I. Only drawback was even in winter the room was too warm at night even though we turned off the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit”
Reviews.Author: elljaaym
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel over New Year for the past 2 years. 2004 & 2005. Ideally located and a comfortable hotel. Yes, breakfast is a little busy, but come on folks, be patient! What do some people want! The food was great and always plentiful and was replenished regualrly. The rooms had modern decor and were far more than adequate. We got great deals on both occasions, and could not complain for the price. It is ideally placed to tour Berlin from. The tour bus goes from the end of the street and is close to Zoo Station. The nearby restaurants were excellent, the one almost opposite -called the Meineke I believe, was good, but we also enjoyed the small restaurant, which you would probably mistake for a bar on the same side as the hotel at the top of the street as you head towards the Ku'Damn. Berlin is a top city and highly recommended for New Year! Try out a trabi safari - it is great fun - especially in 3ft of snow in a car with no heating......................or brakes come to think of it!!

Reviews.Title: “Top marks for the Berlin Mark Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Novice-kay
Reviews.Content: Having spent three nights in the Berlin Mark Hotel I must pass on my findings. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating to any request. The hotel decoration in the corridor area leading to the bedrooms could do with a update but the rooms were very clean tidy and modern. Maid service excellent and staff very friendly. Bar facility available in the room although a kettle with tea/coffee facilities within the room would have been welcomed. The cost of coffees in the bar was very reasonable and always served with a smile. Rooms very comfortable and clean with excellent showering facilities. Cable TV. Fresh fruit at the front reception should anyone wish a piece/s. Meals were excellent, breakfast first class. Location is only 100 mtrs from the Kurfustendamm and very central for bus and S bahn. Luggage room available. I would certainly recommend this hotel and would not hesitate in returning. I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Tatun
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, right around the corner from Ku-damm, but on a quiet street..Excellent rooms with plasma TV, comfy beds..Staff was helpful and personable; absolutely marvellous complimentary breakfast...

Reviews.Title: “Stay away...”
Reviews.Author: jplondon
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weekend in Berlin, where I stayed at the Berlin Mark Hotel. The best thing about this hotel is the location: around the corner from the Kurfurstendam, in central Berlin, and close to lots of public transport. Also, getting taxis from hotel never took more than 3 minutes when the hotel called, which was rather impressive. The hotel is very basic and the room I was given had a single bed (I haven't seen this in hotels for years!) and was smaller than most student accommodation I have seen! The room was extremely basic and the bed and pillow were far too soft, which made me have a terrible time sleeping. I was also given a smoking room. I don't recall Expedia (with whom I booked) asking if I wanted a smoking or non-smoking room, so I felt I didn't have arguments to change. When I asked for a non-smoking room I was told they were fully booked and I couldn't change. Fair enough, but I think there is only one floor in the whole building (of 7 floors) that is non-smoking, so be aware of that when booking. The staff are helpful and nice but the whole place is in serious need of a refurbishment. The decor is very early 80s with some nauseating bright green everywhere... It was also strange to be handed a key, rather than a card for the room, but I suppose that is just me. Brekfast is plentiful but very basic. Beware of smoking areas for people having breakfast that are very close to non-smoking. In fact, the hotel reeked of cigarettes. In other words, if you don't mind the comfort of your bed and if you are a smoker, you will love it! If not, stay away. There are plenty of hotels to choose from in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tressan
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. You can't beat the location and the value. Our room was spotless, great shower and delicious full breakfast. We never had trouble finding a seat and we went at all times of the morning. The area the hotel is in is lovely and it is minutes away from the Zoo Station where you can get any bus or train in the city. We found the staff at the hotel to be lovely. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: felt
Reviews.Content: Good location close to Kurfürstendam. Large hotel with nice rooms and a good bar. Carpark next door. Underground station 5 min. away. Good breakfast buffet (if you can get a seat).

Reviews.Title: “Truly awful”
Reviews.Author: thunderthighs
Reviews.Content: The Mark Hotel on Meineke Strasse is truly not a 3 star hotel. The hotel is very tired and is in desperate need of a refurb.The staff are surly and not interested in any problems you may have. When we booked the room the description on the website said it came with a separate seating area, despite raising the issue with reception we were basically told this was not so , I guess someone needs to amend the website.The room given to us was on the first floor. Supposedly a non smoking room it came complete with ash tray and matches. The room was not very big and the bed took up the majority of the room. The room was at the back of the hotel and overlooked an overgrown garden with a block of flats looking directly onto the rooms. Although the bed linen was clean there wasn't much going for the room at all. The furniture is dark brown and very old and battered and the sliding wardrobe door seemed to be just about hanging on. As for the bathroom well what can we say. The shower sliding door is barely big enough for a normal sized person to get through. The frame of the shower was also falling to pieces and came off in your hand when you closed the door.The shower had no height adjustment bar and so showering each morning was quite difficult. Also it was difficult to regulate the water and it was either boiling hot or freezing cold. You either had to sit cross legged on the shower floor or stand up and use the shower by hand. The hot tap became very hot and a towel had to be used to turn it off. We complained to management three times but nothing was done. One of the lamps over the sink had blown and despite telling the cleaner it was still not changed. The bathroom had had the tiles painted to give the appearance of a newly refurbished room. Breakfast was hardly worth the effort. There were not enough tables for everyone and some people who couldn't get a table ended up going away. If you came down late most of the food had gone and was not replenished. Coffee was luke warm and not a teabag in sight only various types of Twinings darjeeling. We did notice a room next to reception with more tables and a waitress walking in and out with coffee but no one was told if this room was an extra room for breakfast. In fact the room was used to store suitcases for people checking out of their rooms. It was not locked so anyone could walk in. The main reception area and corridors stink of cigarette smoke as there is a table and chairs positioned along the corridor for smokers. The only good thing we can say it that the hotel is in a very good position just off ku'damm and great for exploring Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, horrible service”
Reviews.Author: K.B.7
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and the breakfast was great. Our only problem was the lack of customer service from the individuals at the front desk. The were curt, rude, and when we had a problem with our air conditioner told us that maybe we were used to high powered air conditioning but this is good for here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but.......”
Reviews.Author: donshe62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late March 2006.Very short walk from the train station,very convenient for the city.What sticks out really bad is the decor of the reception area.I felt as though i was in a 80's time warp and i got very worried what would the room be like !.But the room had just been updated and had a nice modern feel,with pale colours and comfortable fittings.Our blind fell off the window at first tug...and not fixed for the entirety of our stay.The room was at the front of the hotel near the really busy cross road,much traffic noise with the windows open,as so much noise from passers by from the 'hard rock cafe' just down the street until 5 in the morning.While we were there a couple of coach loads of teenegers arrived and stayed in the accomodation righ opposite,these kids were obviously not being supervised as they were on the street every night until the early hours partying !.Breakfast is a very well laid out buffet with lots of choice,the only moan here is with so many guests it was hard to find a table,or even when you found a vacant one it was not cleared/cleaned.But on the whole as with all budget hotels there are up's and down's.On the plus....great location....nice rooms/clean.I would stay there again if visiting this magnificent city,but would ask for a room round back.

Reviews.Title: “Marks Hotel Meneike in Berlin-Spare but really good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last week. This hotel is located in a very good area-so location-wise it is four stars. Very accesible to public transportations, 20 minutes from Tegel Airport by bus (#109). Very -very convenient. The hotel is only marked by a green door with a small sign above it- if you blink you would miss it. At around $50.00 a night- it is a good value. $95.00 for week end nights is a bit steep. Breakfast is included- which is a bonus- a pretty good spread- it is possible to have a big breakfast- skip/small lunch- and a big dinner. The room was the definition of bare essentials, mine was a single, it was pretty small. My room has a toilet and shower- no bath tub. The old TV was changed to a flat screen while I was there- so this hotel is doing some upgrading. My room was at the back- it was quiet. Rooms are located off a corridor that is very motel-like except for the original art works along the walls. Caution- the entrance is on the second floor- so I had to lug my heavy suitcase up one flight of stairs. This hotel is not handicap accessible. The staff was friendly and helpful. I will go back if I travel alone or with a regular friend- this is not the hotel for a romantic vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great value...”
Reviews.Author: Ontario13
Reviews.Content: Got a good deal on this hotel and we loved it. Room was a bit small, but very clean. Located about 2 minutes from big shopping area (Kufursterdam) and about 4 minutes from underground station (Kufursterdam again), this hotel was great for us. We always walked 10 minutes to get to the big ZOO station, which connects to just about every line. Lobby has a nice bar and a big room for breakfast. Breakfast was goods with fresh fruit, bacon, eggs, sausage. Proved to be a good start to each day. We had no worries at this hotel and would stay there again if in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nice, quite big hotel 100 m to the kufurstendam. we stayed for 2 nights at the hotel. we had a big room with a lot of space. accros the street there is a nice typical german restaurant which offers good prices. the berlin mark hotel is a excellent hotel and if you wil visite Berlin you really should take this hotel!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay in Berlin and stayed at this hotel. Everything about it is good. Clean rooms, plenty of hot water for showers etc. Hair dryers, excellent maid service. Breakfast something else - everything you could wish for to start the day and a good time slot too - breakfast at the week end is served until 12 noon!!! Ideal for sleepyheads! The only down point was that it is just along the road from the Hard Rock Cafe which appears to close around 2am - but if you close the windows (they are double glazed) it doesnt really bother you too much. The location of this hotel is perfect - right on the doorstep to the shops, underground, buses and sight-seeing buses too. We found a fantastic restaurant too in Joachimstaler Strasse called Blauer Flug - really good meal there too so all in all we spent a fantastic 4 day city break in Berlin and cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: NorwayLiv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here fore three nights, and will do it again. Great location. The breakfast was amazing! The room was nice and clean. The staff friendly. We really can recommend this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel. Immacuately clean. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. The location was also very accessible both on foot and trains to many Berlin Attractions in the centre of Berlin. I would strongly reccomend this hotel and would have no hesitation in staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the Berlin Mark Hotel fantastic value for money. The rooms were spacious and impeccably clean, our room was cleaned every morning. The breakfast was fantastic, buffet style to suit every taste and as much as you want. The reception staff during the day were not too helpful but the night staff were lovely and also the bar staff.The area of Ku'damn is a bit commercial but very safe. I would definitely recommend staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: beso14
Reviews.Content: We paid around $63 a night for our stay in the Berlin Mark Hotel. The room was on the small side but it was very clean the bathroom was huge and modern. The only complaint about the room might be that it was kind of small but this didn't bother us as we just wanted a clean, safe place to sleep. The breakfast (included in the price) was AMAZING! No continental breakfast here! There were eggs, cold cuts, sausage, bacon (one morning), yogurt, fresh and dried fruits, juice, crackers, several different kinds of bread, dessert, etc. You could easily take some stuff for a little snack later in the day. The breakfast alone was worth the price. The location was good. It was under a 10 minute walk to the Berlin Zoo station from which you can catch trains and the metro (U-Bahn). It was right off of the main shopping street. I personally thought that all of the interesting sights seemed to be in East Berllin and found that we were going there to eat, sightsee, etc. Otherwise, I can't really complain about the location. It's right next to the Hard Rock Cafe and down the block from a Dunkin Donuts/Easy Internet cafe. It might be worth mentioning that there seemed to be a lot of school/tour groups staying in the hotel. Sometimes you could hear them in the hallways but it was never a problem or really annoying at all. Also, there was usually a wait for a table at breakfast because everyone in the group seems to eat at the same time. No matter where you stay I highly recommend taking the Free Berlin tour (it leaves from in front of the Dunkin Donuts across from the Berlin Zoo station and you can find info about it posted there). This was really a great tour and it was a highlight of the trip for me.
